meanings.definition: A force that balances another force.
meanings.sent1: The equilibrant kept the object from moving.
meanings.sent2: The equilibrant force prevented the book from falling off the table.
meanings.sent3: The equilibrant force was like a superhero saving the day.
meanings.sent4: The equilibrant acted as a guardian angel, ensuring stability.
meanings.sent5: The equilibrant force was like a sturdy pillar holding everything in place.

meanings.sent1: She tried to equilibrant the seesaw by adding more weight to one side.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to equilibrant the flavors in the dish by adjusting the seasonings.
meanings.sent3: He equilibranted the situation by bringing a cake to the argument.
meanings.sent4: The dancer equilibranted her movements with grace and precision.
meanings.sent5: The teacher equilibranted the classroom by giving equal attention to all students.
